duck: Operation (game), a battery-operated game of physical skill
Operation of law, a legal term that indicates that a right or liability has been created for a party
Unit operation, a basic step in a chemical engineering process
Combined operations, operations by forces of two or more allied nations
Operations research - Operations research, or operational research in British usage, is a discipline that deals with the application of advanced analytical methods to help make better decisions.
An operation in mathematics:
Operation
Operations support system used in the telecommunications industry
http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/operation
Covert operation, an operation which conceals the identity of the sponsor
operation definition: performance of a practical work or of something involving the practical application of principles or processes.
Business operations - Business operations are those ongoing recurring activities involved in the running of a business for the purpose of producing value for the stakeholders.
Operations (military staff), staff involved in planning operations
Scientific operation - Scientific method is a body of techniques for investigating phenomena, acquiring new knowledge, or correcting and integrating previous knowledge.
Surgery, or operation
Arity - In logic, mathematics, and computer science, the arity of a function or operation is the number of arguments or operands that the function takes.

Operations management - Operations management is an area of management concerned with overseeing, designing, controlling the process of production and redesigning business operations in the production of goods and/or s...

Manufacturing operations - Manufacturing operations concern the operation of a facility, as opposed to maintenance, supply and distribution, health, and safety, emergency response, human resources, security, information t...
Sting operation, an operation designed to catch a person committing a crime, by means of deception
Rail transport operations, the control of a rail system
Binary operation - In mathematics, a binary operation is a calculation involving two operands.
Clandestine operation, an intelligence or military operation carried out so that the operation goes unnoticed
Special operations, military operations that are unconventional
Anomalous operation, in parapsychology, a term describing a broad category of purported paranormal effects
Merriam-Webster
Graph operations - Operations on graphs produce new graphs from old ones.
Unary operation - In mathematics, a unary operation is an operation with only one operand, i.e. a single input.
Black operation, an operation that may be outside of standard military protocol or against the law.
Modulo operation - In computing, the modulo operation finds the remainder of division of one number by another.
Operations room, the tactical center providing processed information for command and control of an area of operations
Military operation, a military action (usually in a military campaign) using deployed forces

operation *An operation in mathematics: **Graph operations **Unary operation

a word which represents a function (or instruction), rather than a term or name
*In computer science: **an operation is performed on the basis of an instruction
**Modulo operation *In military and intelligence: **Military operation, a
